channel.title: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]
channel.description:
I have an Server somewhere and i want to run an moparscape server on it, i have SSH access. I can't find anything about an Linux Server (only about how to use the client on linux)...
Is it posible to run a server on linux? And how? :confused:
~Joop~[br][size=1]Posted on: 21-04-2007, 14:32:27[/size][hr]Is this posible?
And how do i Install JDK on an Linux server? (with SSH acces)?
~Joop~ [br][size=1]Posted on: 21-04-2007, 15:30:53[/size][hr]Does someone know the solution?

item.title: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]
item.dc:creator: @kingknight63 kingknight63
item.description:
@kingknight63 wrote:

Joop, if u have ssh acces, do you also have VNC acces?
If you do download a simple program: VNC Viewer
Install it, connect and there you go
U’re in a console (atleast i get in a console)
Than type

sudo apt-get install default-jdk sudo apt-get install openjdk-6-jdk

Now its time to edit your runserver.sh

cd /pj/build /usr/bin/java -cp /pj/build/net/com/codeusa/server.class exit

If you need more help add me on msn. Wpmikeewp@live.nl

Read full topic

item.title: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]
item.dc:creator: @slick slick
item.description:
@slick wrote:

hello im using ubuntu 8.04 - the Hardy Heron - released in April 2008. here is my codes:
my compile.sh:

/home/slick/Desktop/jdk1.6.0_11/bin/javac -cp . *.java

note on compile.sh im using jdk downloaded from:

http://javadl.sun.com/webapps/download/AutoDL?BundleId=26214

my run.sh:

/home/slick/Desktop/jdk1.6.0_11/bin/java -Xm512M server

however not working, compiles with no error but when i run it i get this:
http://www.pastebin.com/m52b17
and cannot login successfully if any1 fixes, plz post!

item.title: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]
item.dc:creator: @SeySayux SeySayux
item.description:
@SeySayux wrote:

Ah you don’t own the server yourself? Nothing is worser than that. I’ve 2 linux servers (currently ubuntu & opensuse, one running abyss web server and another running LAMP… you should know what LAMP is, right?) for personal use & a windows xp home edition server running mysql, abyss, php, ftp… and a rs private server.

item.title: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]
item.dc:creator: @madmax40 madmax40
item.description:
@madmax40 wrote:

He’s talking about a web server.

You must edit the batch file, and type “namehere.sh” as the filename, then upload them all to your server, go into ssh and find the file and select actions -> run.

I’ve not done it yet because my shell doesn’t work right :(.

Read full topic
item.source: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]

item.title: Run an Moparscape Server (not the client) on Linux? [With SSH]
item.dc:creator: @SeySayux SeySayux
item.description:
@SeySayux wrote:

Running a server on linux is as easy as on windows.

First get the jre (prefferably with rpm, apt-get, yum, yast, or whatever you use). If it isn’t in the list, download it from the website

Install it.

Run your server via a terminal simulator such as Konsole.

If that doesn’t help, say me what doesn’t work and also say what distro you use. I can help you with Debian, Red Hat, SuSE Linux & Ubuntu (server edition). (these are the most used anyways)

Read full topic
